intro: Lessingia germanorum var. ramulosissima, commonly known as the ramulose lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. This variant is distinguished by its particularly branched and ramified growth pattern, which gives it its specific epithet.
